message.content: This question requires knowledge about the phenomenon of refraction and what happens when light interacts with a material. Refraction occurs when light bends as it passes from one medium to another. When light interacts with a material, it can be absorbed by that material. Option (C), absorption, is the correct answer because it describes what happens when light stops producing light after hitting something. Options (A), (B), and (D) are unrelated to the concept of refraction. Option (A) is incorrect because light does not sleep. Option (B) is incorrect because smelting refers to the process of melting metal. Option (D) is incorrect because cooking refers to the process of preparing food.

This question requires knowledge about refraction and the behavior of light. Refraction occurs when light bends as it passes from one medium to another. When light hits an object and is absorbed, it stops producing light and its energy is converted into a different form, typically heat or another form of energy. Option (A) is incorrect because light does not "sleep". Option (B) is incorrect because smelting is a process of extracting metal from its ore and has nothing to do with light. Option (D) is incorrect because cooking is not related to the behavior of light.

This question requires basic knowledge about the phenomenon of refraction and the behavior of light. Refraction is the bending of light when it passes from one medium to another with a different refractive index. When light hits an object, it is absorbed by the object, not stopped. Option (A) is incorrect because light does not sleep. Option (B) is unrelated to the behavior of light. Option (D) is also unrelated to the behavior of light. Therefore, option (C) - absorption - is the correct answer.
